edu.biu.scapi.securityLevel
Interface Cca2

All Superinterfaces:
Cca1, Cpa, Eav, EncSecLevel, Indistinguishable, NonMalleable, SecurityLevel
All Known Subinterfaces:
AuthenticatedEnc, CramerShoupDDHEnc, RSAOaepEnc
All Known Implementing Classes:
BcRSAOaep, CramerShoupAbs, CryptoPPRSAOaep, OpenSSLRSAOaep, RSAOaepAbs, ScCramerShoupDDHOnByteArray, ScCramerShoupDDHOnGroupElement, ScEncryptThenMac
public interface Cca2
extends Cca1, NonMalleable

An encryption scheme that is secure in the presence of (full) chosen-ciphertext attacks should implement this interface. Note that any Cca2 scheme is both Indistinguishable and NonMalleable. Thus, Cca2 extends both Cca1 and NonMalleable, and it suffices to have a CCA2-secure scheme implement only the Cca2 interface.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Yael Ejgenberg)
